reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also enjoy all Marriott brand hotels, stay often and am often pleased. I stayed at this hotel recently. Yes, it is in a great location. But soon after entering our room, we found out our TV didn't work. It wouldn't even turn on. We dismissed that because we weren't there to watch TV. When we came back late in the evening and tried to call the front desk, there was a deafening beeping in the phone that even the front desk agent commented on. On top of all this, I didn't sleep at all because every 5 minutes there was a loud bang in the heater which at first I thought someone was breaking in our room!
reviews.title: Nothing worked.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I relayed this information to two front desk agents in the morning, that the TV, phone and heater didn't work. There demeanor was sympathetic but not accomodating. I received a 'sorry' and still had to pay the $200 for...nothing.
reviews.title: Better hotels to stay in, but good location

reviews.text: We are Marriott people, always stay there. Stayed there this New Year's Eve using our Marriott Rewards points, so wasn't too bad. The location is great, right in the middle of things. Parking of course if a ripoff, but expected. $26 per day, not valet either. It's nice to have the Gallery shopping connected to it.
reviews.title: SRA Annual Meeting
Great hotel in a great location.
reviews.text: Room: Bed, of course, is great, typical Marriott. However, hope you don't plan on staying long. Besides the one small drawer on each night stand, there are only two drawers in the whole room for your clothes, besides the closet. That was a little weird.
Also, taking a bath or shower, you notice how they really need to clean the grout. Yuck!
reviews.title: parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our trip to Los Angeles the other day, my girlfriend asked me which hotel I've enjoyed the most this past year. Without hesitation I said the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel in Baltimore and she immediately agreed. The front desk concierge was extremely helpful from helping us check-in due to such a busy night (New Year's Eve) to additional amenities. Due to my Marriott Platinum status we were upgraded to a splendid concierge level room overlooking the harbor. The wine and cheese Platinum arrival gift was superb. All in all a perfect stay during such a hectic time of year.
reviews.title: Amazing Service over New Year's Eve

reviews.text: We've stayed at this hotel a few times now. It is super convenient to the Inner Harbor and what that offers as well as the convention center and the attached mall. It also costs some serious change per night but we've always had a good stay there. The rooms are fantastic and we've always had a great view, especially this last time looking right out into the harbor from our 11th floor room.
reviews.title: For all the $$$ can't I get free internet?

reviews.text: Parking adds $26 to each night for self park but it's quick and easy to get in/out of their underground lot. What I can't swallow is the $13/day charge for Internet access. It makes no sense that for $200+/night you need to pay for internet access. It's not like it was a surprise - I knew they were going to charge. It just doesn't make any sense at all. It is like paying for a first class airlines seat and they charge you for the peanuts. Include the darn Internet access in the room charge!!
reviews.title: Loved our stay at the Renaissance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Factor in 220/night for the room, 26/night for parking and 13/day for wifi and it adds up to be a less then stellar value. $39 for parking and internet is close to 20% on top of the base room price not factoring in the taxes, etc.
reviews.title: RUDE GUESTS - no help from the hotel staff

reviews.text: One (weekend) morning we had plenty of time so we went to the buffet in the hotel. It's not cheap but it was convenient. It's not worth the $$ and the service was definitely slower then it needed to be. I don't know if the waitress was having a bad day or they need more waitresses on that shift, but finding her to get more coffee and the check seemed like I spent an extra 20 mins in the restaurant. No rush, but there were some folks that seemed to be in more of a hurry then we were and they were getting very frustrated.
reviews.title: Safety concerns

reviews.text: The Renaissance Harborplace Hotel is ideally situated if you are planning a lot of activities in the downtown Baltimore area - it is right across the street from the Inner Harbor area with its loads of shops and attractions, and within walking distance of many other nearby attractions. That said, it makes pretentions of being a 5-star hotel, but only a total fool would pay the 5-star price for this place.
reviews.title: Great location - middle of the road hotel

reviews.text: The front desk staff is very good, check-in and check-out were painless and quick. The undergound garage rate is one notch below extortion, yes, and you are well advised to lock anything you want to keep in the trunk - this IS a big city and the criminals DO know where the tourists and all their toys hang out.
reviews.title: unhappy

reviews.text: The rooms are adequate as far as size goes. Furnishings are generally up to date, the bed was comfortable (if anything, they go overboard on the pillows), and the expected extras are in the bathroom. Big minuses are a hefty $12.95 per day charge for internet access, no exhaust fan in the bathroom and rather dim lighting in the mirror there, and a paucity of free channels on the flat screen TV. A smaller minus was the coffee maker, that was cleverly hidden behind the ice bucket in the cabinet under the TV.
reviews.title: superb last minute getaway for spring break

reviews.text: The biggest downsides are room location and noise - there is only ONE bank of elevators for the entire hotel, so long waits can be common, and since the hotel is laid out in a hollow square, be prepared for a lengthy hike if you room is in a far corner. Of greater concern for many might be the noise. The walls are thin, and you will hear almost every conversation and TV program of your neighbors; the corridors also carry sound quite well and loud, late night groups can wake up an entire floor as they make the long trek to their room.
reviews.title: Horrible experience rectified

reviews.text: Contrary to some reviews, I did not find the fifth floor restaurant horribly overpriced, but then I wasn't trying to feed a family. There is a huge variety of restaurants within walking distance, but the view from the Harbor Place restaurant can't be beat. I can't say the same for the ground floor coffee shop, it always seemed either overcrowded, understaffed, or both.
reviews.title: Horrible business center overwhelmed the positives

reviews.text: I loved it. My father and I stayed in this hotel before taking a cruise out of Baltimore. Very comfortable and great location. Service was lacking in the restaurant.
reviews.title: One night stay..

reviews.text: First I would start by saying I think the hotel is gorgeous. I am a Baltimorean and I always pass the hotel and I had a chance to finally visit the quarters. My kids and I was a overnight guess. The kids had a wonderful time however the stay was a bit distrubing to me for a particular inccident. My kids and I went to the pool and the welcome we received was not a good one.... I thought I was the only one who noticed certain mannerism and gestures. The lifeguard who was on duty asked me to asked my girls to be quiet that distrubed me. Nowing that the pool area is inside pool area. A group of girls together enjyoing themselves in the pool is not going to be quiet. However I didnt let it spoil my girls fun time. From the rest of the night my girls enjoy themselves and that's all that matters. They wasnt aware what was going on....Would I recommend this hotel to others? I would say yes because I feel you CANT let one bad seed stop you from enjoying something very nice....
reviews.title: uncomfortable with mannerisms and gestures.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent President's Day Weekend at this hotel after booking it on Priceline for $65. The room was large and the bed was very comfortable. My wife wasn't fond of the decor. As was mentioned earlier, there is a rather puzzling lack of drawer space in the rooms but that didn't bother us on our short visit.
reviews.title: Best Location in Baltimore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had two real complaint about the room itself:
reviews.title: Our first Anniversary at the Harborplace Hotel

reviews.text: - The level of noise from the hallway was unacceptable. The sound seems to resonate through the long hallways.
reviews.title: View second to none, but you pay for it.
Another great stay!
reviews.text: I used Priceline again for a stay at the Inner Harbor in Baltimore and was lucky enough to get this hotel again. The hotel is in a perfect location. Centrally located to everything. The staff were all so helpful and friendly. I don't think one person passed us without speaking or asking if we needed anything. The room was beautiful and the beds very comfortable. I would definitely recommend staying here.

reviews.title: Perfect Location
reviews.text: My family of 4 stayed here 4/18-4/21 and we loved it. The location was perfect, we had two sunny days & two rainy days & staying so close to the harbor made it easy to sightsee even in the rain. Everything is an easy walking distance (Aquarium, Camden Yards, Port Discovery, shopping, Little Italy, water taxi, street entertainers & many restaurants). The view beautiful, clean room, comfy bed & a wonderful breakfast each day. We had a package that included breakfast each day, try to get it because it was well worth it.. Staff excellent & efficient. We will be back to Baltimore & this is the place to stay from what we saw...

reviews.title: A comfortable stay.
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I headed up to see the O's play in Baltimore this past weekend and decided to splurge and spend a night at the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel. It was expensive on our budget, but we booked a water-view room w/ a king size bed. The view was beautiful, the room was clean, and the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in! Check-In was easy, and with the harbor right there we were able to walk right across the street to have dinner and lunch. Camden Yards is also within walking distance. The whole area is exciting, and we had a memorable weekend. We will be staying here the next time we go into Baltimore for the weekend.

reviews.title: What a place!
reviews.text: Our first time to the "Inner Harbor", we loved it. This Hotel is THE location, fantastic views, much to see and do, lots of history and the chef at this Hotel knows his stuff. If you have never been to the harbor you must go, we came here by luck, we were in DC and decided to see something else and WOW!

reviews.title: Renaissance Harborplace is a great place to stay
reviews.text: We loved our time at this hotel. We got a great price through Priceline.com; I wouldn't have wanted to pay the rack rate. The hotel was clean; the rooms were comfortable, they had nice soaps etc. The bed was very comfortable with deluxe bedding. I liked just having one king sized bed rather than the two regular or queen sized beds you usually have in a hotel. I never need two beds for just my husband and me. I have read a lot of comments that the walk from the elevators to the rooms can be too long; our room was about as far from the elevator as you can be and I didn't find the walk all that daunting. It may be a long walk for people with small children or the infirm/elderly. Parking was costly. But we loved being right in the middle of the attractions at the Inner Harbor. Everything was very clean and nice and the staff was friendly and helpful. I would stay here again, with the help of a good rate from Priceline.com.

Stayed here for a quick weekend trip to the circus with a 6 and 3 year old. Stay started off on the wrong foot with not being able to park - valet or otherwise due to the St. Patrick's day parade. Was told to park at the garage 2 blocks away. Was not allowed to leave luggage while I parked. Was told can not leave luggage unattended. Was not going to leave a 6 and 3 year old by themselves. Paid $18 for 4 hours, then moved car back to hotel lot. Had to pay $21 to park again. Dissapointed with no help with luggage. Had to pull 2 rollerboards, computer bag, Barbies in backpack and hold the hands of 2 children for a 2 block walk.
reviews.title: Nice but...

likes.disliked: — lack of cleanliness, issues with parking

reviews.text: Check in staff was very friendly. Room was on the concierge level and very large. One of the largest rooms I have stayed in. TV did not work, unable to repair to get all stations, so kids were disappointed that they could not watch Hannah Montana in bed (something they are not allowed to do at home). Upon tucking the girls in I noticed that the sheets were dirty. Not stained but dirty. Crusty as if someone was eating in bed. Also several long black hairs which did not belong to us. I called reception and someone was up immediately to change the linens. No apology was ever offered though.
reviews.title: Great hotel for business or pleasure

likes.liked: — I loved the way they treated me---even though I booked off Priceline!
likes.disliked: — I would have liked a safe in the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lounge staff was extremely friendly as was most of the hotel staff. Girls liked the pool and the location was great. Would I stay here again. Probably. Mainly due to location than anything else.
reviews.title: Great location, great stay!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Baltimore Harborplace Hotel on a business trip. I got a great rate of $99/night off Priceline. This is a great hotel!
reviews.title: Love the Location
Great location in Inner Harbor, convenient to Camden Yards
reviews.text: The hotel is about 15-20 minutes from BWI (depending on traffic.) It is easy to find. Valet is $36/ night. They were very efficient. I only needed a 5-minute warning to have my car brought around.

Stayed here again while in town for a baseball game....always clean and comfortable.....employees always very friendly and helpful......right across the street from inner harbor.......about 5-6 block walk to oriole park at camden yards.....price was $180.00 total...priceline....a solid 4 star......will stay again......
reviews.title: Nice Again

reviews.text: This hotel has the best location you’d hope for Baltimore. It is not right in the harbor as some of the pictures listed on various websites may suggest, but it is in walking distance of all the happenings, great restaurants, the Aquarium, and basically connected to a pretty nice mall. I love shopping so this was just very convenient, for spending a few hours. Also, the selection of restaurant is so big that you can find food for absolutely any tastes and budgets within 10 minutes walking. I would also assume that the proximity of the Aquarium is a plus for family with children: we had the closing night dinner there and I can say this place is a must see for anyone, not only for kids.
reviews.title: A bit disappointing

reviews.text: The room was clean and spacious, and everything worked as expected. We arrived at lunchtime, along with 100 other tourists, so the check in process was a bit slow, but there is nothing I would hold accountable the hotel for. My room had a nicely sized sitting area, and the work desk was a bit aside from the bed which made working at late hours a bit less difficult.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However what I didn’t like about the place was the fact that the Internet was not free. You’d expect that once you paid $250+ for a room, something as little as the Internet was included. Yet we’ve been charged $10 a day, and here comes the worse part, for a service that we didn’t use. And this wasn’t a mistake made on my bill, because the colleague of mine I traveled with was charged the same thing, although she didn’t even bring her laptop with her. We both complained about this, and had the charges taken off.
reviews.title: Perfect location for the Harbor or Johns Hopkins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The day after I got back to the office, I submitted my expenses sheet, when my boss asked me about a $60 charge that I didn’t even noticed. I called the hotel, and it turned out that I had been billed for a dinner for two although none of us even ate at the hotel restaurant. The hotel representative opened an investigation, and a week later they called me apologizing for the mistake. However, I found a bit disturbing the fact that they made two mistakes on the same bill.
reviews.title: A True Gem in Charm City...

reviews.text: I stayed at the Renaissance 7/6/08-7/9/08.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location, right across the street from the Inner Harbor area which has lots of shops and restaurants. I was in meetings all day at another hotel so I did not get a chance to check out everything the hotel has to offer.
reviews.title: Great for a Weekend Getaway

likes.liked: — Great hotel in an absolutely great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff I encountered was very professional and helpful. When I checked in, I was asked what type of bed I wanted and whether I wanted to be on a high floor or low floor. I got what I wanted. However, I completely forgot to ask for a view of the Inner Harbor and ended up with a courtyard view.
reviews.title: We'll be back!

reviews.text: I only ate breakfast at the hotel. I tried the scrambled eggs (very good), the cheese and ham omelette (okay) and the pancakes (so-so).
reviews.title: Great Service, Great Food

likes.liked: — Great hotel staff and great service!

reviews.text: I'm thinking of going back to Baltimore for a weekend of leisure with my husband and 6-year-old. I would stay at this hotel again. The location can't be beat.
reviews.title: All that glitters is not gold....

likes.disliked: — Not on the harbor as advertised, noisy, not enough value for the money.
